text: hello this is Bill Cunningham
interesting in fashion this week is why
most men will never get out of the
conventional suit the shirt and a tie
there's a new generation as we've said
many times who are enjoying
experimenting with new styles and it's
terrific to see them come along with
sometimes very daring experiments we saw
a lot of it this fall
mixing conventional clothes with
oversized scarf or a coat that's
different something with texture or
color it mean it's very often very
subtle like the fellow here with the Tom
Brown very conventional Chesterfield
coat but the back flaps have inside red
white and blue grosgrain ribbon which is
his signature but I thought there was a
good cross-section here of what's going
on in men's clothes and how young men
are more open to experimentation which
we've been watching for the last ten
years at least out of it will come
something that will push fashion forward
for men and as we all know men's fashion
travels at a snail's pace
so these fellas are really in many cases
the first line of the first troops in
the fashion field what I thought was
interesting this year of Bergdorf
Goodman's windows is the men's store and
the windows are terrific they're men's
clothes but they've put animal heads on
the mannequins so you have in a
conventional suit to tie a lion doing
barbells or you have the bull and the
bear in Obama's chair I mean there's all
sorts of funny things or I'm even better
was the cap may account walking the dogs
and then on the woman's store they have
women mannequins but in them they have
men
manikins all in animal headdresses and
it plays up the idea while the clothes
are very conventional and very
conservative there's that added fantasy
of the animal heads so I hope you enjoy
it and it was fun to put together and
gather up and see how men were putting
and mixing things up
